llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach = 1 — strong positive driver (shap_value +2.68416, direction: increase). The ACH payment format is the largest contributor to the flag.
- amount_received = 19426.8 — positive driver (shap_value +1.0768, direction: increase). The relatively large received amount increased the model score.
- amount_paid = 19426.8 — positive driver (shap_value +0.531365, direction: increase). The paid amount also pushed the score higher.
- dayofweek = 5 (Saturday) — positive driver (shap_value +0.473488, direction: increase). The transaction occurring on dayofweek 5 contributed to increasing the score.
- from_bank = 23402 — negative driver (shap_value -0.345949, direction: decrease). The sending bank ID reduced the model score somewhat.

Conclusion:
The transaction was flagged mainly because payment_format_ach (ACH) and the high amounts (amount_received and amount_paid) substantially increased the model score, with an additional upward contribution from occurring on dayofweek = 5 (Saturday). The sending bank (from_bank = 23402) modestly lowered the score but did not offset the larger positive drivers. (If the model aggregates SHAP contributions additively, the net positive contributions explain why this transaction was flagged.)
